intro: Connarus marginatus, commonly known as the marginated connarus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with a waxy coating. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
